page.title: 02Erewash Museum
page.content: Somewhere between 1750 and 1760, the house which is now the museum was built. The building was a hostel for children before it was turned into a museum. Michael House School used to own the building but at the moment the Erewash Borough Council take care of it. The museum partly opened in September 1981 and officially started on April 23rd. In the museum there is on the ground floor a display of the museum's collection of Civic regalia relating to Ilkeston and Long Eaton. On the first floor there is a bedroom which has been changed into a Victorian sitting room where there are some models dressed up in Victorian clothes, and a Lady playing a piano. One model looks out of a window and there is also another model with an 1860's dress on.
